acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was assembled by the Lebanon Historical Society from a variety of local sources between 2002 and 2013. There are four known donors, including The Towns of Lebanon, Dorothy Stevens, Rowland Manning, and Alison McBride. There is one Anonymous donor and one Unknown donor.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: In 1947 a search was conducted by Voice of America for a U.S. community that highlighted the virtues of democracy over communism. Lebanon Connecticut was chosen as the perfect American village to show these virtues. An American Community in Action, was published in 1950 and printed in 20 languages and distributed to two million people in 50 counties.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: This collection includes English and Russian copies of An American Community in Action, along with other documents pertaining to the creation of An American Community in Actions. A photo album, letters, slides and newspaper articles are included in this Collection.
